channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-5206] Flakey PythonPlanBinderTest
item.description:

Results :

Failed tests: 
  PythonPlanBinderTest>JavaProgramTestBase.testJobWithoutObjectReuse:180 Error while calling the test program: Job execution failed.

Maybe, a parallel test is cleaning up this directory? It should probably use a unique output path anyway.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I got the same again: https://api.travis-ci.org/jobs/182038489/log.txt?deansi=true

GitHub user zentol opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/2973

FLINK-5206 [py] Use random file names in tests

This PR modifies the python tests to use random file names.

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/zentol/flink 5206_py_tests

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/2973.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #2973

commit 30abf5628766886775dfbd9c49518a49da222afc
Author: zentol <chesnay@apache.org>
Date: 2016-12-08T18:29:03Z

FLINK-5206 [py] Use random file names in tests

Github user StephanEwen commented on the issue:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/2973

+1 for this from my side

Github user zentol commented on the issue:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/2973

@StephanEwen Thank your for the review, merging.

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/2973

It seems to happen again with the following exception.

java.io.IOException: Mkdirs failed to create /tmp/flink

at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
